commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Well, that's everyone.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: At least it went off without any issues, more or less.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I don't know if we can say "without any issues"...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Aside from the numbers situation, Setsuna's explanation was easy to follow and it got everyone who came pretty hyped, right?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: About the numbers... Did we make a mistake in how we recruited volunteers or something?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: We got 1,000 so fast, so we thought that meant we'd done everything right and it worked.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: But now we're right back where we started.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: We still have time to recruit more. We can try again. Rina-chan Board says, "Serious!"

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, we don't have time to be getting down on ourselves.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: That's right. We can overcome this together! Don't you agree?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? Oh, yeah... Yup, you're right. We just have to try harder.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: So, shall we put everything back in order? First, we need to collect all the packets that were left on chairs.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Collect them... Rina-chan Board says, "Sad-face."

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We only needed enough for the front of the auditorium...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: What should we do with the leftover ones?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: We'll hold onto them in the clubroom. I'm sure we'll need them again later.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Yeah. I think we have some extra cardboard boxes, so we can put them in those.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh, I need to return the projector.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll take that back. I know you're all tired, so let's call it a night here. Thank you for your hard work, and good night!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, okay... Good night.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Shioriko said people want someone else to do it and they believe someone else definitely will.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hmm. I might have gotten caught in the same kind of thinking. I thought that because people signed up, they'd make good on it for sure.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I got so fixated on believing they'd pull through that I didn't consider their enthusiasm levels when signing up, or what kinds of people they were.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I needed to really focus on making sure we were actually getting people who would commit, but I ended up just assuming it would work out.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I can't let everyone's hard work and dreams up until this point go to waste. We have a little bit more time, so I've got to stick the landing this time for sure!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: She's taking today off, too?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: How many days has it been since she told us she won't be able to come to club meetings because she has something to do? It's so boring without her!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes, we do miss her, but she's being a responsible club president and working hard on our behalf. So we mustn't whine about it.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: What exactly is she doing?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I heard she's contacting everyone who didn't show up to the info session.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Whoa... But that's so many people. She's contacting every single one of them?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: And she's not just calling them. If she can, she's going to meet them in person.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: She's been working so hard until late every single night. I feel pretty worried.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Ayumu, have you heard anything? You're neighbors, right?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, but lately I haven't gotten to talk to her... She's leaving the house early every morning. She'll text me back at night, but doesn't seem to ever have much time to talk.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I do hope she's not running herself ragged.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I'm worried...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I'm definitely worried too, but more than that I miss her! If she's watching, then I feel like I can work even harder!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, I agree. And there's been almost no new entries in that notebook of hers lately.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Even though just the other day, we were laughing about how it's almost completely filled up...

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Whenever I looked at that notebook, I'd feel such a rush of inspiration. I loved it.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I really do want her here with us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yes? Oh, I see. No... Thank you. I'm sorry for bothering you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Sigh*

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: There you are!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I heard a voice outside and wondered if it was you. Were you on the phone?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, yeah, I was... Was I so loud you could hear me? Sorry about that.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: No, I wasn't thinking that at all. It's more like... It's been a while since we got to talk like this. You haven't been coming to the clubroom, and everyone misses you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh... I'm sorry about that. I've been making you handle everything. But right now, there are other things I have to do.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: About those other things... Would you let us help you with that? I think it'd go much faster if we could all work on it together.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You think that... But what you think might work is just too uncertain.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I know you're worried about me, and I'm grateful for that. But this is my job to do.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: If we're too naive again, we'll just end up right back where we are now. If I don't take this seriously, we won't get 1,000 people. That's why I want to do this properly.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: And it isn't your job to help me, right? I just want you to focus on what you should be doing, Ayumu.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Anyway, I've got to get back to sending out messages. Good night, Ayumu.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: She's acting strange... She wouldn't look me in the eyes once. She didn't even glance my way...
